title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy addressed concerns over Red Sox's commitment to winning, emphasizing the team's focus on success.
Rafael Devers was traded to San Francisco following conflicts over role adjustments within the team.
Alex Bregman joined the Cubs with a $175 million contract, as Red Sox couldn't meet his no-trade clause request.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured after shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people were killed, including the suspected shooter, and three injured at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket, R.I. during a hockey game.
The shooting at the high school event was described by Pawtucket mayor as a 'targeted family dispute'.
Authorities, including Rhode Island State Police and ATF, are investigating the incident; victims' names have not been released.

title: Jaylen Brown calls out city of Beverly Hills for shutting down his All-Star Weekend event
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown's All-Star event in Beverly Hills was shut down due to claims of lacking a necessary permit.
The Beverly Hills Police Department stated the event was shut down due to previous violations at the venue's address.
Brown argued no permit was needed for the event, held at Oakley founder James Jannard's mansion, and denied permit rejection claims.

title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison; Baez received two years; both must pay restitution.
The scheme involved stealing, altering, and fraudulently depositing checks from USPS collection boxes.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained by ICE in May 2025; his arrest targeted his father over an expired visa.
Gomes' detention sparked community protests; he described conditions in the ICE facility as 'humiliating.'

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a regrettable center-ice goal during Team USA's win over Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Swayman humorously responded to the goal but acknowledged he lost sight of the puck due to a 'flash screen.'
Team USA overpowered Denmark with strong offense, making Swayman's 18 saves sufficient for the win.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum nears return from Achilles injury, missing his first All-Star event in six years.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony comment on Tatum's potential return and its impact on Celtics' playoff chances.
Tatum recently practiced with Celtics' G League affiliate, sparking optimism about his comeback.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots enter offseason with $41 million in cap space, targeting key free agents at positions of need.
Potential targets include Colts WR Alec Pierce, Packers OT Rasheed Walker, and Bills C Connor McGovern.
Patriots also eye Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips as strategic additions.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN has partnered with MLB.TV, making it the streaming home for MLB games this season.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can purchase MLB.TV for $134.99, while non-subscribers can get it for $149.99 with a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers will renew automatically and can stream games via the MLB app or ESPN app after linking accounts.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics as he rehabs from an Achilles injury.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. noted Tatum looked like his usual self during the practice session.
Despite Tatum's practice, the Celtics have not confirmed a timetable for his return to NBA games.
